title: How to Set a Ringtone for an Android Contact

steps.title: Open the Phone app on your Samsung Galaxy phone.
steps.content: Open the Phone app on your Samsung Galaxy phone. It's the green-and-white phone receiver icon on the home screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Contacts tab.
steps.content: Tap the Contacts tab. This displays a list of your contacts. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap a contact.
steps.content: Tap a contact. Some options will expand below. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the small "i" in a circle.
steps.content: Tap the small "i" in a circle. You will find this below the contact's name and phone number. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . It's the pencil icon at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap View More.
steps.content: Tap View More . Additional options will appear.

steps.title: Tap Ringtone.
steps.content: Tap Ringtone . A list of ringtones on your Android will appear. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Select a ringtone.
steps.content: Select a ringtone. Choose from one of the built-in ringtones on your Android, or tap the + at the top-right corner to select a ringtone you've downloaded or created. [6] X Research source If you're selecting a custom ringtone, select your audio file, and then tap Done to attach it to the selected contact.

steps.title: Tap the back button and select Save.
steps.content: Tap the back button and select Save . After choosing the ringtone, you'll need to tap the back button to return to their contact information. Tap Save at the bottom of the screen to save your contact's new custom ringtone.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . It's at the bottom-right corner. The next time your contact calls you, you will hear the selected ringtone.

steps.title: Open the Google Contacts app.
steps.content: Open the Google Contacts app. The Google Contacts app comes preinstalled on all Google Pixels, the latest OnePlus models, Moto Power, and many other popular handsets. Look for a blue icon that's an outline of a person. Some Androids come with a different app called Contacts—you may be able to use that app to change a person's ringtone, but the steps will be a little different. If you don't have Google Contacts, you can download it from the Play Store .

steps.title: Tap the contact you want to edit.
steps.content: Tap the contact you want to edit. This opens the contact's details.

steps.title: Tap the three vertical dots at the top-right corner ⋮.
steps.content: Tap the three vertical dots at the top-right corner ⋮ . A menu will expand. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Set ringtone on the menu.
steps.content: Tap Set ringtone on the menu. A list of ringtones will expand. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the ringtone you want to use.
steps.content: Tap the ringtone you want to use. This assigns the selected ringtone to your contact. You can now close the Contacts app or use the back button to customize another contact. If you want to choose an audio file instead of one of the built-in ringtones, select Add ringtone at the bottom of the list, tap the three-line menu, tap Files , tap Audio , and then choose the song. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . Your custom ringtone is now set for the selected contact.
